name: Zone
title: Gcloud
Dns
Zone
description:
DNS Zone

The managed zone is the container for DNS records for the same DNS name suffix and has a set of name servers that accept and responds to queries. A project can have multiple managed zones, but they must each have a unique name.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
dns = gcloud.dns
zone = dns.zone "example-com"
zone.records.each do |record|
  puts record.name
end

methods.name: id
title: Gcloud
Dns
Zone#id
methods.description: Unique identifier for the resource; defined by the server.

methods.name: name
title: Gcloud
Dns
Zone#name
methods.description: User assigned name for this resource. Must be unique within the project. The name must be 1-32 characters long, must begin with a letter, end with a letter or digit, and only contain lowercase letters, digits or dashes.

methods.name: dns
title: Gcloud
Dns
Zone#dns
methods.description: The DNS name of this managed zone, for instance “example.com.”.

methods.name: description
title: Gcloud
Dns
Zone#description
methods.description: A string of at most 1024 characters associated with this resource for the user’s convenience. Has no effect on the managed zone’s function.

methods.name: name_servers
title: Gcloud
Dns
Zone#name_servers
methods.description: Delegate your managed_zone to these virtual name servers; defined by the server.

methods.name: name_server_set
title: Gcloud
Dns
Zone#name_server_set
methods.description: Optionally specifies the NameServerSet for this ManagedZone. A NameServerSet is a set of DNS name servers that all host the same ManagedZones. Most users will leave this field unset.

methods.name: created_at
title: Gcloud
Dns
Zone#created_at
methods.description: The time that this resource was created on the server.

methods.name: delete
title: Gcloud
Dns
Zone#delete
methods.description: Permanently deletes the zone.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
dns = gcloud.dns
zone = dns.zone "example-com"
zone.delete

examples.caption: The zone can be forcefully deleted with the force option:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
dns = gcloud.dns
zone = dns.zone "example-com"
zone.delete force: true

params.name: force
params.description: If true, ensures the deletion of the zone by first deleting all records. If false and the zone contains non-essential records, the request will fail. Default is false.

returns.description: Returns true if the zone was deleted.

methods.name: clear!
title: Gcloud
Dns
Zone#clear!
methods.description: Removes non-essential records from the zone. Only NS and SOA records will be kept.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
dns = gcloud.dns
zone = dns.zone "example-com"
zone.clear!

methods.name: change
title: Gcloud
Dns
Zone#change
methods.description: Retrieves an existing change by id.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
dns = gcloud.dns
zone = dns.zone "example-com"
change = zone.change "2"
if change
  puts "#{change.id} - #{change.started_at} - #{change.status}"
end

params.name: change_id
params.description: The id of a change.

returns.description: Returns nil if the change does not exist.

methods.name: changes
title: Gcloud
Dns
Zone#changes
methods.description: Retrieves the list of changes belonging to the zone.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
dns = gcloud.dns
zone = dns.zone "example-com"
changes = zone.changes
changes.each do |change|
  puts "#{change.id} - #{change.started_at} - #{change.status}"
end

examples.caption: The changes can be sorted by change sequence:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
dns = gcloud.dns
zone = dns.zone "example-com"
changes = zone.changes order: :desc

examples.caption: With pagination: (See Gcloud::Dns::Change::List)
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
dns = gcloud.dns
zone = dns.zone "example-com"
changes = zone.changes
loop do
  changes.each do |change|
    puts "#{change.name} - #{change.status}"
  end
  break unless changes.next?
  changes = changes.next
end

params.name: token
params.description:
A previously-returned page token representing part
of the larger set of results to view.

params.name: max
params.description: Maximum number of changes to return.

params.name: order
params.description:
Sort the changes by change sequence.

Acceptable values are:

  • asc - Sort by ascending change sequence
  • desc - Sort by descending change sequence

methods.name: records
title: Gcloud
Dns
Zone#records
methods.description: Retrieves the list of records belonging to the zone. Records can be filtered by name and type. The name argument can be a subdomain (e.g., www) fragment for convenience, but notice that the retrieved record’s domain name is always fully-qualified.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
dns = gcloud.dns
zone = dns.zone "example-com"
records = zone.records
records.each do |record|
  puts record.name
end

examples.caption: Records can be filtered by name and type:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
dns = gcloud.dns
zone = dns.zone "example-com"
records = zone.records "www", "A"
records.first.name #=> "www.example.com."

examples.caption: With pagination: (See Gcloud::Dns::Record::List)
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
dns = gcloud.dns
zone = dns.zone "example-com"
records = zone.records "example.com."
loop do
  records.each do |record|
    puts record.name
  end
  break unless records.next?
  records = records.next
end

examples.caption: Retrieve all pages: (See Gcloud::Dns::Record::List#all)
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
dns = gcloud.dns
zone = dns.zone "example-com"
records = zone.records.all

params.name: name
params.description:
Return only records with this domain or subdomain
name.

params.name: type
params.description: Return only records with this record type. If present, the name parameter must also be present.

params.name: token
params.description:
A previously-returned page token representing part
of the larger set of results to view.

params.name: max
params.description: Maximum number of records to return.

methods.name: record
title: Gcloud
Dns
Zone#record
methods.description: Creates a new, unsaved Record that can be added to a Zone.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
dns = gcloud.dns
zone = dns.zone "example-com"
record = zone.record "example.com.", "A", 86400, ["1.2.3.4"]
zone.add record

methods.name: export
title: Gcloud
Dns
Zone#export
methods.description: Exports the zone to a local DNS zone file.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
dns = gcloud.dns
zone = dns.zone "example-com"

zone.export "path/to/db.example.com"

params.name: path
params.description:
The path on the local file system to write the data
to.The path provided must be writable.

returns.description: An object on the local file system.

methods.name: import
title: Gcloud
Dns
Zone#import
methods.description:
Imports resource records from a DNS zone file, adding the new records to the zone, without removing any existing records from the zone.

Because the Google Cloud DNS API only accepts a single resource record for each name and type combination (with multiple data elements), the zone file’s records are merged as necessary. During this merge, the lowest ttl of the merged records is used. If none of the merged records have a ttl value, the zone file’s global TTL is used for the record.

The zone file’s SOA and NS records are not imported, because the zone was given SOA and NS records when it was created. These generated records point to Cloud DNS name servers.

This operation automatically updates the SOA record serial number unless prevented with the skip_soa option. See #update for details.

The Google Cloud DNS service requires that record names and data use fully-qualified addresses. The @ symbol is not accepted, nor are unqualified subdomain addresses like www. If your zone file contains such values, you may need to pre-process it in order for the import operation to succeed.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
dns = gcloud.dns
zone = dns.zone "example-com"
change = zone.import "path/to/db.example.com"

params.name: path_or_io
params.description:
The path to a zone file on the
filesystem, or an IO instance from which zone file data can be read.

params.name: only
params.description:
Include only records of this type or
types.

params.name: except
params.description:
Exclude records of this type or
types.

params.name: skip_soa
params.description: Do not automatically update the SOA record serial number. See #update for details.

params.name: soa_serial
params.description: A value (or a lambda or Proc returning a value) for the new SOA record serial number. See #update for details.

returns.description:
A new change adding the imported Record
instances.

methods.name: update
title: Gcloud
Dns
Zone#update
methods.description:
Adds and removes Records from the zone. All changes are made in a single API request.

The best way to add, remove, and update multiple records in a single transaction is with a block. See Zone::Transaction.

If the SOA record for the zone is not present in additions or deletions (and if present in one, it should be present in the other), it will be added to both, and its serial number will be incremented by adding 1. This update to the SOA record can be prevented with the skip_soa option. To provide your own value or behavior for the new serial number, use the soa_serial option.

examples.caption: Using a block:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
dns = gcloud.dns
zone = dns.zone "example-com"
change = zone.update do |tx|
  tx.add     "example.com.", "A",  86400, "1.2.3.4"
  tx.remove  "example.com.", "TXT"
  tx.replace "example.com.", "MX", 86400, ["10 mail1.example.com.",
                                           "20 mail2.example.com."]
  tx.modify "www.example.com.", "CNAME" do |cname|
    cname.ttl = 86400 # only change the TTL
  end
end

examples.caption: Or you can provide the record objects to add and remove:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
dns = gcloud.dns
zone = dns.zone "example-com"
new_record = zone.record "example.com.", "A", 86400, ["1.2.3.4"]
old_record = zone.record "example.com.", "A", 18600, ["1.2.3.4"]
change = zone.update [new_record], [old_record]

examples.caption: Using a lambda or Proc to update the current SOA serial number:
examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
dns = gcloud.dns
zone = dns.zone "example-com"
new_record = zone.record "example.com.", "A", 86400, ["1.2.3.4"]
change = zone.update new_record, soa_serial: lambda { |sn| sn + 10 }

params.name: additions
params.description:
The Record or array of records
to add.

params.name: deletions
params.description:
The Record or array of records
to remove.

params.name: skip_soa
params.description:
Do not automatically update the SOA record
serial number.

params.name: soa_serial
params.description:
A value (or a lambda or Proc
returning a value) for the new SOA record serial number.

params.name: yield
params.description: a block yielding a new transaction

params.name: yield.tx
params.description: the transaction object

methods.name: add
title: Gcloud
Dns
Zone#add
methods.description:
Adds a record to the Zone. In order to update existing records, or add and delete records in the same transaction, use #update.

This operation automatically updates the SOA record serial number unless prevented with the skip_soa option. See #update for details.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
dns = gcloud.dns
zone = dns.zone "example-com"
change = zone.add "example.com.", "A", 86400, ["1.2.3.4"]

params.name: name
params.description: The owner of the record. For example: example.com..

params.name: type
params.description: The identifier of a supported record type. For example: A, AAAA, CNAME, MX, or TXT.

params.name: ttl
params.description:
The number of seconds that the record can be cached
by resolvers.

params.name: data
params.description: The resource record data, as determined by type and defined in RFC 1035 (section 5) and RFC 1034 (section 3.6.1). For example: 192.0.2.1 or example.com..

params.name: skip_soa
params.description: Do not automatically update the SOA record serial number. See #update for details.

params.name: soa_serial
params.description: A value (or a lambda or Proc returning a value) for the new SOA record serial number. See #update for details.

methods.name: remove
title: Gcloud
Dns
Zone#remove
methods.description:
Removes records from the Zone. The records are looked up before they are removed. In order to update existing records, or add and remove records in the same transaction, use #update.

This operation automatically updates the SOA record serial number unless prevented with the skip_soa option. See #update for details.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
dns = gcloud.dns
zone = dns.zone "example-com"
change = zone.remove "example.com.", "A"

params.name: name
params.description: The owner of the record. For example: example.com..

params.name: type
params.description: The identifier of a supported record type. For example: A, AAAA, CNAME, MX, or TXT.

params.name: skip_soa
params.description: Do not automatically update the SOA record serial number. See #update for details.

params.name: soa_serial
params.description: A value (or a lambda or Proc returning a value) for the new SOA record serial number. See #update for details.

methods.name: replace
title: Gcloud
Dns
Zone#replace
methods.description:
Replaces existing records on the Zone. Records matching the name and type are replaced. In order to update existing records, or add and delete records in the same transaction, use #update.

This operation automatically updates the SOA record serial number unless prevented with the skip_soa option. See #update for details.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
dns = gcloud.dns
zone = dns.zone "example-com"
change = zone.replace "example.com.", "A", 86400, ["5.6.7.8"]

params.name: name
params.description: The owner of the record. For example: example.com..

params.name: type
params.description: The identifier of a supported record type. For example: A, AAAA, CNAME, MX, or TXT.

params.name: ttl
params.description:
The number of seconds that the record can be cached
by resolvers.

params.name: data
params.description: The resource record data, as determined by type and defined in RFC 1035 (section 5) and RFC 1034 (section 3.6.1). For example: 192.0.2.1 or example.com..

params.name: skip_soa
params.description: Do not automatically update the SOA record serial number. See #update for details.

params.name: soa_serial
params.description: A value (or a lambda or Proc returning a value) for the new SOA record serial number. See #update for details.

methods.name: modify
title: Gcloud
Dns
Zone#modify
methods.description:
Modifies records on the Zone. Records matching the name and type are yielded to the block where they can be modified.

This operation automatically updates the SOA record serial number unless prevented with the skip_soa option. See #update for details.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
dns = gcloud.dns
zone = dns.zone "example-com"
change = zone.modify "example.com.", "MX" do |mx|
  mx.ttl = 3600 # change only the TTL
end

params.name: name
params.description: The owner of the record. For example: example.com..

params.name: type
params.description: The identifier of a supported record type. For example: A, AAAA, CNAME, MX, or TXT.

params.name: skip_soa
params.description: Do not automatically update the SOA record serial number. See #update for details.

params.name: soa_serial
params.description: A value (or a lambda or Proc returning a value) for the new SOA record serial number. See #update for details.

params.name: yield
params.description: a block yielding each matching record

params.name: yield.record
params.description: the record to be modified

methods.name: fqdn
title: Gcloud
Dns
Zone#fqdn
methods.description: This helper converts the given domain name or subdomain (e.g., www) fragment to a fully qualified domain name (FQDN) for the zone’s #dns. If the argument is already a FQDN, it is returned unchanged.

examples.code:
require "gcloud"

gcloud = Gcloud.new
dns = gcloud.dns
zone = dns.zone "example-com"
zone.fqdn "www" #=> "www.example.com."
zone.fqdn "@" #=> "example.com."
zone.fqdn "mail.example.com." #=> "mail.example.com."

params.name: domain_name
params.description:
The name to convert to a fully qualified
domain name.
